title.narrative: Provision of integrated Protection and Health Assistance to Afghan Refugees

description.narrative: The action responds to the protection, MNCH and primary healthcare needs of Afghan refugees in 10 districts of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP). It will be implemented by a consortium formed by ICMC as lead organisation and The Johanniter. From June 1st, 2017, ICMC will initiate healthcare services in Jalala (Mardan), Khairabad (Nowshera) and Voluntary Repatriation Center (VRC) Chamkani (Peshawar). ICMC is already providing health services in Peshawar, Charsadda, Buner and Chitral with ECHO funds and proposes the continuation of these services from January 1st, 2018 to May 31st, 2018. ICMC will provide qualified staff, medicines and medical supplies to ensure the availability of emergency lifesaving healthcare to refugees, will train health workers and organize health awareness sessions. ICMC also proposes to continue refugee protection activities (through its implementing partner SHARP) from January 1st, 2018 to May 31st, 2018 and provide free legal aid on civil cases, assistance for documentation's issuance and other general and legal information. Enhancing capacity of the legal practitioners and mass awareness raising of communities will also remain a key activity. Similarly from June 1st 2017, Johanniter (through its implementing partner FPHC) will establish 1 BEmONC and 3 MCH centers in Mansehra and 4 MCH centers in Haripur. Johanniter is already operating 4 BEmONC (1 Haripur, 1 Nowshera, 2 Swabi) and 6 MCH centers (2 Haripur, 2 Nowshera, 2 Swabi) through ECHO funds and proposes the continuation of these MCH and BEmONC centers from January 1st 2018 to May 31st 2018. Johanniter will run 24/7 labor room and provide ANC, PNC, basic diagnostic services and management of childhood illnesses (IMNCI). Obstetric emergencies will be referred in ambulance. Optimum IYCF practices will be promoted as per national policy on breastfeeding. Capacity building of skilled birth attendants and CHW will be ensured.
